text: The last time frame participant, and the most influential time frame participant, is the long term investor, also known as paper traders. First and foremost, they're not price sensitive. Paper traders tend to focus heavily on the fundamentals, giving more attention to the fundamentals than the technicals. When they're active, they tend to have very large orders, and they're quite visible More importantly, these orders don't tend to just occur for one day, but they tend to be ongoing for a number of days, even weeks. Long-term paper is responsible for breaking new ground and starting new trends. Fundamentals are far more important than market-generated information, and most important, they're not price-sensitive, and that is why they're very price-influential As we can see by the example provided, this is a daily type time frame. Longer term investors tend to focus on the fundamentals given to us by central banks, the data from various nations, as well as all the macro events occurring around the globe. They then tend to use the technicals to confirm the fundamental picture that they understand.
